Class AirportSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • AirportSystem

  • public class AirportSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that contains the implementation for a graph-like airport system
    Author:
    Nikhil Jindal

    • Field Summary

      (package private) java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,AirportSystem.Vertex> connections

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addEdge(java.lang.String source, java.lang.String destination, int weight)
      Adds an edge between two vertices in the graph with the given weight The edges are bi-directional, so they are added to both the source and destination
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> breadthFirstSearch(java.lang.String start)
      Returns a list of cities from the start city using breadth-first search This assumed the start vertex city exits
      java.util.List<AirportSystem.Edge> minimumSpanningTree()
      Uses Prim's algorithm to create a minimum spanning tree of the airport system
      void printGraph()
      Prints a representation of the entire airport system and the connections from each city
      int shortestDistance(java.lang.String cityA, java.lang.String cityB)
      Returns the shortest distance between both citys using Dijkstr's algorithm

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        public boolean addEdge(java.lang.String source,
                       java.lang.String destination,
                       int weight)
        Adds an edge between two vertices in the graph with the given weight The edges are bi-directional, so they are added to both the source and destination
        Parameters:
        source - the source city of the flight
        destination - the destination city of the flight
        weight - the distance between the two cities
        Returns:
        true if the edge was successfully added

      • shortestDistance

        public int shortestDistance(java.lang.String cityA,
                            java.lang.String cityB)
        Returns the shortest distance between both citys using Dijkstr's algorithm
        Parameters:
        cityA - the source city
        cityB - the destination city
        Returns:
        the distance between the two cities

      • minimumSpanningTree

        public java.util.List<AirportSystem.Edge> minimumSpanningTree()
        Uses Prim's algorithm to create a minimum spanning tree of the airport system
        Returns:
        a list of edges that make up the minimum spanning tree

      • breadthFirstSearch

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> breadthFirstSearch(java.lang.String start)
        Returns a list of cities from the start city using breadth-first search This assumed the start vertex city exits
        Parameters:
        start - the city to start the search in
        Returns:
        a list of strings of the city names that appear in the BFS

      • printGraph

        public void printGraph()
        Prints a representation of the entire airport system and the connections from each city
